content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Creating References
A reference variable is a "reference" to an existing variable, and 
it is created with the
&
operator:
string food = "Pizza";  // food variable
string &meal = food;    
  // reference to food
Now, we can use either the variable name
food
or the reference name
meal
to refer to the
food
variable:
Example
string food = "Pizza";
string &meal = food;
cout << food << "\n";  
  // Outputs Pizza
cout << meal << "\n";  // 
  Outputs Pizza
